intro: Ptychococcus elatus, commonly known as the golden starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange inflorescence. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers arranged in a compact cluster, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. The botanical features of Ptychococcus elatus make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
